smile.netlib

Class ARPACK

  • java.lang.Object
    • smile.netlib.ARPACK

  • public class ARPACK
extends java.lang.Object
    ARPACK based eigen decomposition. Currently support only symmetric matrix.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ARPACK.Ritz
      Specify which of the Ritz values of OP to compute.

    • Method Detail

      • eigen

        public static EVD eigen(Matrix A,
                        int k,
                        ARPACK.Ritz ritz)
        Find k approximate eigen pairs of a symmetric matrix by the Lanczos algorithm.
        Parameters:
        k - Number of eigenvalues of OP to be computed. 0 < k < N.
        ritz - Specify which of the Ritz values to compute.

      • eigen

                        java.lang.String which)
        Find k approximate eigen pairs of a symmetric matrix by the Lanczos algorithm.

        k - Number of eigenvalues of OP to be computed. 0 < k < N.
        which - Specify which of the Ritz values to compute.

      • eigen

        public static EVD eigen(Matrix A,
                        int k,
                        ARPACK.Ritz ritz,
                        double kappa,
                        int maxIter)
        Find k approximate eigen pairs of a symmetric matrix by the Lanczos algorithm.
        Parameters:
        k - Number of eigenvalues of OP to be computed. 0 < k < N.
        ritz - Specify which of the Ritz values to compute.
        kappa - Relative accuracy of ritz values acceptable as eigenvalues.
        maxIter - Maximum number of iterations.

      • eigen

        public static EVD eigen(Matrix A,
                        int k,
                        java.lang.String which,
                        double kappa,
                        int maxIter)
        Find k approximate eigen pairs of a symmetric matrix by the Lanczos algorithm.
        Parameters:
        k - Number of eigenvalues of OP to be computed. 0 < NEV < N.
        which - Specify which of the Ritz values to compute.
        kappa - Relative accuracy of ritz values acceptable as eigenvalues.
        maxIter - Maximum number of iterations.
